line_1: And almost hop'd — by Prudes to be forgiven.
line_2: Veil'd in some convent made her peace with heaven,

line_1: To testify Their Sins forgiven —
line_2: And still He makes Their Claim to Heaven!

line_1: To sue for grace, and hope to be forgiven,
line_2: Teach me, tho' humbl'd, to look up to Heav'n,

line_1: Bewail'd his error, pray'd to be forgiven,
line_2: The wretched father rais'd his eyes to Heaven,

line_1: Should know, should feel my Sins forgiven,
line_2: Blest with this Antepast of Heaven!

line_1: Believe; and all your Guilt's forgiven,
line_2: Only Believe — and yours is Heaven.

line_1: With all her sins and faults forgiven,
line_2: A peaceful shelter find in heaven;

line_1: There still is mercy — you may be forgiv'n.
line_2: Reflect on this, and turn your eyes to Heav'n;

line_1: Seal of my Sins in CHRIST forgiv'n,
line_2: Earnest of Love, and Pledge of Heav'n.

line_1: Unless my sins: O! may they be forgiv'n,
line_2: And all my happiness be plac'd in heav'n!

line_1: Shall you! ye stubborn hearted, be forgiv'n?
line_2: Can you expect a charity from Heav'n?

line_1: I'll glory then in Sin Forgiven,
line_2: In CHRIST my Life, my Love, my Heaven!

line_1: Thy Heart has felt its Sins forgiv'n,
line_2: And tastes Anticipated Heav'n.

line_1: I would; for I have much forgiv'n.
line_2: And watch the Smile of op'ning Heav'n:

line_1: I know my Sins are now forgiv'n!
line_2: Nor keep my Life, to lose my Heav'n.

line_1: " We need to be forgiven;
line_2: " We lose our promis'd heaven.

line_1: His spotless love might be forgiven
line_2: By ev'ry saint in earth and heav'n.

line_1: Peace on Earth to Man forgiv'n,
line_2: Man the Well-belov'd of Heav'n!

line_1: Dies by the sword, and hopes to be forgiven;
line_2: Yet man, vain man, breaks through the laws of heaven,

line_1: Shout Your Sins in CHRIST forgiv'n,
line_2: Sons of GOD, and Heirs of Heav'n!

line_1: Most nun-like mourns, and hopes to be forgiv'n.
line_2: She lifts her eyes, her sparkling eyes to heav'n,

line_1: That whispers all my Sins forgiv'n;
line_2: That quench'd the Wrath of hostile Heav'n:

line_1: And pray that my Sins be forgiv'n:
line_2: I may dwell in a Palace in Heav'n.

line_1: And meek-eyed mercy say, "thou art forgiven,"
line_2: Until they guide us to their native Heaven.

line_1: Too big to be forgiven.
line_2: There's no Relief in Heaven;

line_1: Repent in vain, scarce wish to be forgiven;
line_2: Thy form my idol, and thy charms my heaven.

line_1: And feel while here their every fault forgiven.
line_2: Thrice happy they who taste this early heaven,

line_1: And trust, and feel, our every fault forgiven?
line_2: Is't then we taste the promis'd joys of heaven,

line_1: Had but the monks the frantic rage forgiven,
line_2: Nor sent his pure and ardent soul to heaven,

line_1: And, for my countless tears and sighs, to be forgiven.
line_2: I only hope to wing my soul to heaven,

line_1: Repent and be forgiven;
line_2: A holy day in heav'n.

line_1: On the worn heart — I sure shall be forgiv'n,
line_2: I go uncall'd — to mercy and to Heav'n!

line_1: As thou forgav'st, so thou shalt be forgiven!
line_2: Oh! think, when summoned to the throne of Heaven,
